statements.name: PROC CAPABILITY
statements.description: A process capability analysis compares the distribution of output from an in-control process to its specification limits to determine the consistency with which the specifications can be met. The CAPABILITY procedure provides the following: † o process capability indices, such as Cp and Cpk o descriptive statistics based on moments, including skewness and kurtosis. Other descriptive information provided includes quantiles or percentiles (such as the median), frequency tables, and details on extreme values. o histograms and comparative histograms. Optionally, these can be superimposed with specification limits, fitted probability density curves for various distributions, and kernel density estimates. o cumulative distribution function plots (cdf plots). Optionally, these can be superimposed with specification limits and probability distribution curves for various distributions. o quantile-quantile plots (Q-Q plots), probability plots, and probability-probability plots (P-P plots). These plots facilitate the comparison of a data distribution with various theoretical distributions. Optionally, Q-Q plots and probability plots can be superimposed with specification limits. o goodness-of-fit tests for a variety of distributions including the normal. The assumption of normality is critical to the interpretation of capability indices. o statistical intervals (prediction, tolerance, and confidence intervals) for a normal population o the ability to produce plots either as traditional graphics, ODS Graphics output, or legacy line printer plots. Traditional graphics can be saved, replayed, and annotated. o the ability to inset summary statistics and capability indices in graphical output o the ability to analyze data sets with a frequency variable o the ability to read specification limits from a data set o the ability to create output data sets containing summary statistics, capability indices, histogram intervals, parameters of fitted curves, and statistical intervals † You can use the PROC CAPABILITY statement, together with the VAR and SPEC statements, to compute summary statistics and process capability indices.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Requests all of the tables generated by the FREQ, MODES, NEXTRVAL=5, CIBASIC, CIPCTLDF, and CIPCTLNORMAL options.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies the default confidence level for all confidence limits computed by the CAPABILITY procedure. The coverage percent for the confidence limits is (1-value)100. For example, ALPHA=0.10 results in 90% confidence limits. The default value is 0.05.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies an input data set containing annotate variables as described in SAS/GRAPH documentation.

arguments.name: CHECKINDICES
arguments.description: Specifies the test of normality used in conjunction with process capability indices that are displayed in the Process Capability Indices table.

arguments.name: CIBASIC
arguments.description: Requests confidence limits for the mean, standard deviation, and variance based on the assumption that the data are normally distributed. TYPE=keyword specifies the type of confidence limit, where keyword is LOWER, UPPER, or TWOSIDED. The default value is TWOSIDED.

arguments.name: CIPCTLDF
arguments.description: Requests confidence limits for quantiles computed using a distribution-free method. TYPE=keyword specifies the type of confidence limit, where keyword is LOWER, UPPER, SYMMETRIC, or ASYMMETRIC. The default value is SYMMETRIC.

arguments.name: CIPCTLNORMAL
arguments.description: requests confidence limits for quantiles based on the assumption that the data are normally distributed. TYPE=keyword specifies the type of confidence limit.

arguments.name: CIPROBEX
arguments.description: Requests confidence limits for Pr[X <= LSL] and Pr[X ≥ USL], where X is the analysis variable, LSL is the lower specification limit, and USL is the upper specification limit. TYPE=keyword specifies the type of confidence limit, where keyword is LOWER, UPPER, or TWOSIDED. The default value is TWOSIDED.

arguments.name: CPMA=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of the parameter α for the capability index Cpm(a). This option has been superseded by the SPECIALINDICES(CPMA=) option.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies the input data set containing the observations to be analyzed.

arguments.name: EXCLNPWGT
arguments.description: Excludes observations with non-positive weight values (zero or nonnegative) for the analysis.

arguments.name: FORMCHAR=
arguments.description: Defines characters used for features on plots, where index is a number ranging from 1 to 11, and string is a character or hexadecimal string. The index identifies which features are controlled with the string characters. The features associated with values of index are as follows: Index Description of Character Chart Feature 1 vertical bar frame, ecdf line, HREF= lines 2 horizontal bar frame, ecdf line, VREF= lines 3 box character (upper left) frame, ecdf line, histogram bars 4 box character (upper middle) histogram bars, tick marks (horizontal axis) 5 box character (upper right) frame, histogram bars 6 box character (middle left) histogram bars 7 box character (middle middle) not used 8 box character (middle right) histogram bars, tick marks (vertical axis) 9 box character (lower left) frame 10 box character (lower middle) histogram bars 11 box character (lower right) frame, ecdf line

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: Requests a frequency table in the printed output that contains the variable values, frequencies, percentages, and cumulative percentages.

arguments.name: GOUT=
arguments.description: Specifies a graphics catalog in which to save graphics output.

arguments.name: LINEPRINTER
arguments.description: Requests that line printer plots be produced. By default, the procedure creates traditional graphics.

arguments.name: LOCCOUNT
arguments.description: Requests a table with the number of observations greater than, not equal to, and less than the value of MUO=.

arguments.name: MODES
arguments.description: Requests a table of all possible modes. By default, when the data contains multiple modes, PROC CAPABILITY displays the lowest mode in the table of basic statistical measures. When all values are unique, PROC CAPABILITY does not produce a table of modes.

arguments.name: MU0=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of the mean or location parameter (uo) in the null hypothesis for the tests summarized in the table labeled Tests for Location: Mu0=value.

arguments.name: NEXTROBS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of extreme observations in the table labeled Extreme Observations. The table lists the n lowest observations and the n highest observations. The default value is 5.

arguments.name: NEXTRVAL=
arguments.description: Requests the table labeled Extreme Values and specifies the number of extreme values in the table. The table lists the n lowest unique values and the n highest unique values. The value of n must be an integer between 0 and half the maximum number of observations.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses the tables of descriptive statistics and capability indices which are created by the PROC CAPABILITY statement.

arguments.name: NORMALTEST
arguments.description: Requests a table of Tests for Normality for each of the analysis variables.

arguments.name: OUTTABLE=
arguments.description: Specifies an output data set that contains univariate statistics and capability indices arranged in tabular form.

arguments.name: PCTLDEF=
arguments.description: Specifies one of five definitions used to calculate percentiles.
Definition 1 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 2 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 3 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 4 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 5 for computing quantile statistics

arguments.name: ROBUSTSCALE
arguments.description: Requests a table of robust measures of scale. These measures include the interquartile range, Gini's mean difference, the median absolute deviation about the median (MAD), and two statistics proposed by Rousseeuw and Croux (1993), Qn, and Sn.

arguments.name: ROUND=
arguments.description: Specifies units used to round variable values.

arguments.name: SPECIALINDICES
arguments.description: Requests a table of specialized process capability indices. You can specify the following options in parentheses after the SPECIALINDICES option: CPMA=value specifies the value of the parameter, a, for the capability index Cpm(a) CPU=value specifies the value of the parameter, u, for Vännmann's capability index Cp(u,v). CPV=value specifies the value of the parameter v for Vännmann's capability indices Cp(u,v) and Cp(v).

arguments.name: SPECS=
arguments.description: Specifies an input data set containing specification limits for each of the variables in the VAR statement.

arguments.name: TRIMMED=
arguments.description: Requests a table of trimmed means, where each value specifies the number or the proportion of trimmed observations. TYPE=keyword specifies the type of confidence limit, where keyword is LOWER, UPPER, or TWOSIDED. The default value is TWOSIDED.

arguments.name: VARDEF=
arguments.description: Specifies the divisor to use in the calculation of variances and standard deviations.

arguments.name: DF
arguments.description: Degrees of freedom

arguments.name: N
arguments.description: Number of observations

arguments.name: WDF
arguments.description: Sum of weights minus one

arguments.name: WEIGHT
arguments.description: Sum of weights

arguments.name: WINSORIZED=
arguments.description: Requests a table of winsorized means, where each value specifies the number or the proportion of winsorized observations. TYPE=keyword specifies the type of confidence limit, where keyword is LOWER, UPPER, or TWOSIDED. The default value is TWOSIDED.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: The BY statement specifies variables in the input data set that are used for BY processing. A separate chart is created for each set of observations defined by the levels of the BY variables. The input data set must be sorted in order of the BY variables.

statements.name: CDFPLOT
statements.description: Plots the observed cumulative distribution function (cdf) of a variable.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies the shape parameter α (α > 0) for distribution functions requested with the BETA and GAMMA options.

arguments.name: ALPHADELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option.

arguments.name: ALPHAINITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option. Enclose the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.

arguments.name: ANNOKEY
arguments.description: Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

arguments.name: BETA
arguments.description: Displays a fitted beta distribution function on the cdf plot. Description of beta-options:

arguments.name: BETA=
arguments.description: Specifies the second shape parameter, β, for beta distribution functions requested by the BETA option.

arguments.name: C=
arguments.description: Specifies the shape parameter, c, for Weibull distribution functions requested with the WEIBULL option.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

arguments.name: CDELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option in parentheses after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in c between consecutive steps is less than the value specified or until the number of iterations exceeds the value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

arguments.name: CDFSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to plot the points on cdf line printer plots. The default is the plus sign (+).

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area is not filled by default.

arguments.name: CFRAMESIDE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CFRAMETOP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across the top of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

arguments.name: CINITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 option. The default value is 1.8.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: CONTENTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot statement. You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

arguments.name: CPROP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding cell in a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: CTEXTSIDE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: CTEXTTOP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable name.

arguments.name: EXPONENTIAL
arguments.description: Displays a fitted exponential distribution function on the cdf plot. Description of exponential-options:

arguments.name: FITINTERVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

arguments.name: FITMETHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. By default, the method of percentiles is used.

arguments.name: PERCENTILE
arguments.description: Method of percentiles.

arguments.name: MLE
arguments.description: Method of MLE.

arguments.name: MOMENTS
arguments.description: Method of moments.

arguments.name: FITTOLERANCE=
arguments.description: Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: GAMMA
arguments.description: Displays a fitted gamma distribution function on the cdf plot. Description of gamma-options: ALPHADELTA=value -- specifies change in successive estimates of α at which the Newton-Raphson approximation of -hat terminates ALPHAINITIAL=value -- specifies initial value for α in the Newton-Raphson approximation of α-hat MAXITER= -- specifies maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of α-hat SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ, for gamma distribution function ALPHA=value -- specifies shape parameter, α, for gamma distribution function THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ, for gamma distribution function COLOR=color -- specifies color of theoretical distribution function L=linetype -- specifies line type of theoretical distribution function SYMBOL='character' -- specifies character used to plot theoretical distribution function on line printer plots W= -- specifies width of theoretical distribution function

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark labels, and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: HMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

arguments.name: HREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: HREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.
Along top of plot
Staggered from top to bottom of plot
Along bottom of plot
Staggered from bottom to top of plot

arguments.name: INFONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The INFONT= option takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: INHEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed areas of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: INTERTILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 to create contiguous tiles.

arguments.name: L=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line types in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limit reference lines and superimposed distribution functions.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses all legend information and is equivalent to specifying the NOLEGEND option.

arguments.name: LHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= option. By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: LOGNORMAL
arguments.description: Displays a fitted lognormal distribution function on the cdf plot. Description of lognormal-options:

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. Enclose the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The default value of n is 20.

arguments.name: MU=
arguments.description: Specifies the parameter, µ, for normal distribution functions requested with the NORMAL option.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 'UNIVAR'.

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only one CLASS variable, and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

arguments.name: NOCDFLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend for the superimposed theoretical cumulative distribution function.

arguments.name: NOECDF
arguments.description: Suppresses the observed distribution function (the empirical cumulative distribution function) of the variable, which is drawn by default.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.

arguments.name: NOHLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses legends for specification limits, theoretical distribution functions, and hidden observations.

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: Displays a fitted normal distribution function on the cdf plot. Description of normal-options:

arguments.name: NOSPECLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the portion of the legend for specification limit reference lines.

arguments.name: NOVLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

arguments.name: NOVTICK
arguments.description: Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option also suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

arguments.name: OVERLAY
arguments.description: Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid onto a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

arguments.name: SHAPE=
arguments.description: Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for the C= option for distributions requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

arguments.name: SIGMA=
arguments.description: Specifies the parameter, σ, for distribution functions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, NORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

arguments.name: SYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to plot the theoretical distribution function on line printer plots. Enclose the SYMBOL= option in parentheses after the distribution option.

arguments.name: THETA=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for theoretical cumulative distribution functions requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

arguments.name: THRESHOLD=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for theoretical cumulative distribution functions requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

arguments.name: TURNVLABELS
arguments.description: Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. This happens by default when you use a hardware font.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VAXISLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

arguments.name: VMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also see the CVREF= and LVREF= options.

arguments.name: VREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.
Labels are positioned to the left of the plot.
Labels are positioned to the right of the plot.

arguments.name: VSCALE=
arguments.description: Specifies the scale of the vertical axis.

arguments.name: COUNT
arguments.description: Scales the data in units of the number of observations per data unit.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: Scales the data in units of percent of observations per data unit. This is the default.

arguments.name: PROPORTION
arguments.description: Scales the data in units of proportion of observations per data unit.

arguments.name: W=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of widths in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: WAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

arguments.name: WEIBULL
arguments.description: Displays a fitted Weibull distribution function on the cdf plot. Description of Weibull-options:

arguments.name: ZETA=
arguments.description: Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ, for a lognormal distribution function requested with the LOGNORMAL option.

statements.name: CLASS
statements.description: The CLASS statement specifies one or two variables used to group the data into classification levels. Variables in a CLASS statement are referred to as CLASS variables. CLASS variables can be numeric or character. Class variables can have floating point values, but they typically have a few discrete values that define levels of the variable. You do not have to sort the data by CLASS variables. PROC CAPABILITY uses the formatted values of the CLASS variables to determine the classification levels. Note:You cannot specify a COMPHISTOGRAM statement together with a CLASS statement.

arguments.name: KEYLEVEL=
arguments.description: Specifies the key cells in comparative plots. For each plot, PROC CAPABILITY first determines the horizontal axis scaling for the key cell, and then extends the axis using the established tick interval to accommodate the data ranges for the remaining cells, if necessary. Thus, the choice of the key cell determines the uniform horizontal axis that PROC CAPABILITY uses for all cells.

arguments.name: NOKEYMOVE
arguments.description: Specifies that the location of the key cell in a comparative plot be unchanged by the CLASS statement KEYLEVEL= option. By default, the key cell is positioned as the first cell in a comparative plot.

statements.name: COMPHISTOGRAM
statements.description: Creates a comparative histogram. You must specify at least one variable and either one or two class-variables (also referred to as classification variables). * The COMPHISTOGRAM statement displays a component histogram of the values of the variable for each level of the class-variables.

arguments.name: ALPHADELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option.

arguments.name: ALPHAINITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option. Enclose the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.

arguments.name: ANNOKEY
arguments.description: Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

arguments.name: BARLABEL=
arguments.description: Displays labels above the histogram bars.

arguments.name: COUNT
arguments.description: The label shows the number of observations associated with a given bar.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: The label shows the percentage of observations represented by that bar.

arguments.name: PROPORTION
arguments.description: The label displays the proportion of observations associated with the bar.

arguments.name: BARWIDTH=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the histogram bars in percentage screen units.)>

arguments.name: C=
arguments.description: Specifies the standardized bandwidth parameter c for kernel density estimates requested with the KERNEL option.

arguments.name: value-list
arguments.description: Specifies the standardized bandwidth parameter c for kernel density estimates requested with the KERNEL option.

arguments.name: MISE
arguments.description: Requests the bandwidth parameter that minimizes the estimated mean integrated square error (MISE).

arguments.name: MISE
arguments.description: Requests the bandwidth parameter that minimizes the estimated mean integrated square error (MISE).

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

arguments.name: CBARLINE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the outline of the histogram bars when producing traditional graphics.

arguments.name: CDELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option in parentheses after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in c between consecutive steps is less than the value specified or until the number of iterations exceeds the value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

arguments.name: CFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the bars of the histogram (or the area under a fitted density curve if you also specify the FILL option) when producing traditional graphics.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area is not filled by default.

arguments.name: CFRAMENLEG=
arguments.description: Specifies that the legend requested with the NLEGEND option (or the variable _TILELB_ in a CLASSSPEC= data set) is to be framed and that the frame is to be filled with the color indicated.

arguments.name: color
arguments.description: Specifies that the legend requested with the NLEGEND option (or the variable _TILELB_ in a CLASSSPEC= data set) is to be framed and that the frame is to be filled with the color indicated.

arguments.name: EMPTY
arguments.description: Specifies that the legend requested with the NLEGEND option (or the variable _TILELB_ in a CLASSSPEC= data set) is to be framed but not filled with a color.

arguments.name: CFRAMESIDE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CFRAMETOP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across the top of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for grid lines requested with the GRID option.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

arguments.name: CINITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 option. The default value is 1.8.

arguments.name: CLASS=
arguments.description: Specifies that a comparative histogram is to be created using the levels of the variables (also referred to as class-variables or classification variables).

arguments.name: CLASSKEY=
arguments.description: Specifies that a comparative histogram is to be created using the levels of the variables (also referred to as class-variables or classification variables).

arguments.name: CLASSSPEC=
arguments.description: Specifies a data set that provides distinct specification limits for each cell, as well as a color, legend, and label for the corresponding tile.

arguments.name: CLIPSPEC=
arguments.description: Specifies that histogram bars are clipped at the upper and lower specification limit lines when there are no observations outside the specification limits.

arguments.name: CLIP
arguments.description: The histogram bar is truncated at the specification limit.

arguments.name: NOFILL
arguments.description: The portion of a filled histogram bar outside the specification limit is left unfilled.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: CONTENTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot statement. You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

arguments.name: CPROP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding cell in a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: CTEXTSIDE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: CTEXTTOP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable name.

arguments.name: ENDPOINTS=
arguments.description: Specifies that histogram interval endpoints, rather than midpoints, are aligned with horizontal axis tick marks, and specifies how the endpoints are determined.

arguments.name: value-list
arguments.description: The values must be listed in increasing order and must be evenly spaced. The difference between consecutive endpoints is used as the width of the histogram bars

arguments.name: KEY
arguments.description: The procedure first determines the endpoints for the data in the key cell. The initial number of endpoints is based on the number of observations in the key cell by using the method of Terrell and Scott (1985).

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: The procedure determines the endpoints by using all the observations as if there were no cells. In other words, the number of endpoints is computed from the total sample size by using the method of Terrell and Scott (1985).

arguments.name: FILL
arguments.description: Fills areas under a fitted density curve with colors and patterns. Enclose the FILL option in parentheses after the keyword NORMAL or KERNEL.

arguments.name: FITINTERVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

arguments.name: FITMETHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. By default, the method of percentiles is used.

arguments.name: PERCENTILE
arguments.description: Method of percentiles.

arguments.name: MLE
arguments.description: Method of MLE.

arguments.name: MOMENTS
arguments.description: Method of moments.

arguments.name: FITTOLERANCE=
arguments.description: Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: FRONTREF
arguments.description: Draws reference lines requested with the HREF= and VREF= options in front of the histogram bars.

arguments.name: GRID
arguments.description: Displays a grid to the comparative histogram.

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark labels, and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: HMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

arguments.name: HOFFSET=
arguments.description: Specifies the offset, in percentage screen units, at both ends of the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: HREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: HREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.
Along top of plot
Staggered from top to bottom of plot
Along bottom of plot
Staggered from bottom to top of plot

arguments.name: INFONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The INFONT= option takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: INHEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed areas of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: INTERTILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 to create contiguous tiles.

arguments.name: K=
arguments.description: Specifies the kernel function (normal, quadratic, or triangular) used to compute a kernel density estimates requested with the KERNEL option.

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: Normal kernel function

arguments.name: QUADRATIC
arguments.description: Quadratic kernel function

arguments.name: TRIANGULAR
arguments.description: Triangular kernel function

arguments.name: KERNEL
arguments.description: Requests a kernel density estimate for each cell of the comparative histogram. You can specify the kernel-options described below:

arguments.name: L=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line types in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: LGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the grid requested with the GRID option.

arguments.name: LHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= option. By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower bound for a kernel density estimate curve. Enclose the LOWER= option in parentheses after the KERNEL option.

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. Enclose the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The default value of n is 20.

arguments.name: MAXNBIN=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of bins to be displayed.

arguments.name: MAXSIGMAS=
arguments.description: Limits the number of bins to be displayed to a range of value standard deviations (of the data in the key cell) above and below the mean of the data in the key cell.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: Specifies how to determine the midpoints for the histogram intervals, where values determines the width of the histogram bars as the difference between consecutive midpoints.

arguments.name: value-list
arguments.description: The values must be listed in increasing order and must be evenly spaced. The difference between consecutive midpoints is used as the width of the histogram bars.

arguments.name: KEY
arguments.description: The procedure first determines the midpoints for the data in the key cell. The initial number of midpoints is based on the number of observations in the key cell by using the method of Terrell and Scott (1985). The midpoint list for the key cell is then extended in either direction as necessary until it spans the data in the remaining cells.

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: The procedure determines the midpoints using all the observations as if there were no cells. In other words, the number of midpoints is computed from the total sample size by using the method of Terrell and Scott (1985).

arguments.name: MISSING1
arguments.description: Specifies that missing values of the first CLASS= variable are to be treated as a level of the CLASS= variable.

arguments.name: MISSING2
arguments.description: Specifies that missing values of the second CLASS= variable are to be treated as a level of the CLASS= variable.

arguments.name: MU=
arguments.description: Specifies the parameter, µ, for normal density curves requested with the NORMAL option.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 'UNIVAR'.

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only one CLASS variable, and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

arguments.name: NLEGEND=
arguments.description: Specifies the form of a legend that is displayed inside each tile and indicates the sample size of the cell. The following two forms are available: o If you specify the NLEGEND option, the form is N=n where n is the cell sample size.

arguments.name: NLEGENDPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the position of the legend requested with the NLEGEND option or the variable _TILELB_ in a CLASSSPEC= data set.

arguments.name: NW
arguments.description: The legend is displayed in the northwest corner of the tile

arguments.name: NE
arguments.description: The legend is displayed in the northeast corner of the tile.

arguments.name: NOBARS
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of the bars in a comparative histogram.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.

arguments.name: NOHLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

arguments.name: NOKEYMOVE
arguments.description: Suppresses the rearrangement of cells that occurs by default when you use the CLASSKEY= option to specify the key cell.

arguments.name: NOPLOT
arguments.description: Suppresses the creation of a comparative histogram.

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: Displays a normal density curve for each cell of the comparative histogram. The following normal-options can be specified:

arguments.name: NOVLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

arguments.name: NOVTICK
arguments.description: Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option also suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

arguments.name: ORDER1=
arguments.description: Specifies the display order for the values of the first CLASS= variable.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in increasing order of the internal (unformatted) values of the first CLASS= variable.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in increasing order of the formatted values of the first CLASS= variable.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in the order in which the values of the first CLASS= variable first appear in the input data set.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in order of decreasing frequency count.

arguments.name: ORDER2=
arguments.description: Specifies the display order for the values of the second CLASS= variable.

arguments.name: INTERNAL
arguments.description: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in increasing order of the internal (unformatted) values of the first CLASS= variable.

arguments.name: FORMATTED
arguments.description: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in increasing order of the formatted values of the first CLASS= variable.

arguments.name: DATA
arguments.description: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in the order in which the values of the first CLASS= variable first appear in the input data set.

arguments.name: FREQ
arguments.description: The rows (columns) are displayed from top to bottom (left to right) in order of decreasing frequency count.

arguments.name: OUTHISTOGRAM=
arguments.description: Creates a SAS data set that saves the midpoints or endpoints of the histogram intervals, the observed percent of observations in each interval, and (optionally) the percent of observations in each interval estimated from a fitted normal distribution.

arguments.name: OVERLAY
arguments.description: Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid onto a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

arguments.name: PFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies a pattern used to fill the bars of the histograms (or the areas under a fitted curve if you also specify the FILL option) when producing traditional graphics.

arguments.name: RTINCLUDE
arguments.description: Includes the right endpoint of each histogram interval in that interval.

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

arguments.name: SHAPE=
arguments.description: Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for the C= option for distributions requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

arguments.name: SIGMA=
arguments.description: Specifies the parameter, σ, for normal density curves requested with the NORMAL option.

arguments.name: TILELEGLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label displayed to the left of the legend that is created when you provide _CTILE_ and _TILELG_ variables in a CLASSSPEC= data set. The label can be up to 16 characters and must be enclosed in quotes. The default label is Tiles:.

arguments.name: TURNVLABELS
arguments.description: Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. This happens by default when you use a hardware font.

arguments.name: UPPER=
arguments.description: Specifies the upper bound for a kernel density estimate curve.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VAXISLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

arguments.name: VMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

arguments.name: VOFFSET=
arguments.description: Specifies the offset, in percentage screen units, at the upper end of the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also see the CVREF= and LVREF= options.

arguments.name: VREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.
Labels are positioned at the left of the plot.
Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

arguments.name: VSCALE=
arguments.description: Specifies the scale of the vertical axis.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: Scales the data in units of percent of observations per data unit. This is the default.

arguments.name: COUNT
arguments.description: Scales the data in units of the number of observations per data unit.

arguments.name: PROPORTION
arguments.description: Scales the data in units of proportion of observations per data unit.

arguments.name: W=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of widths in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: WAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

arguments.name: WBARLINE=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of bar outlines. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: WGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the grid lines requested with the GRID option.

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: The FREQ statement names a variable that provides frequencies for each observation in the input data set. If n is the value of the FREQ variable for a given observation, then that observation is used n times. If the value of the FREQ variable is missing or is less than one, the observation is not used in the analysis. If the value is not an integer, only the integer portion is used.

statements.name: HISTOGRAM
statements.description: Histograms are typically used in process capability analysis to compare the distribution of measurements from an in-control process with its specification limits.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies the shape parameter α (α > 0) for distribution functions requested with the BETA and GAMMA options.

arguments.name: ALPHADELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option.

arguments.name: ALPHAINITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option. Enclose the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.

arguments.name: ANNOKEY
arguments.description: Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

arguments.name: BARLABEL=
arguments.description: Displays labels above the histogram bars.

arguments.name: COUNT
arguments.description: The label shows the number of observations associated with a given bar.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: The label shows the percentage of observations represented by that bar.

arguments.name: PROPORTION
arguments.description: The label displays the proportion of observations associated with the bar.

arguments.name: BETA
arguments.description: Displays a fitted beta density curve on the histogram. You can specify the following beta-options:

arguments.name: BETA=
arguments.description: Specifies the second shape parameter, β, for beta distribution functions requested by the BETA option.

arguments.name: BMCFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies the fill color for a box-and-whisker plot in a bottom margin requested with the BMPLOT= option.

arguments.name: BMCFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for filling the frame of a bottom margin plot requested with the BMPLOT= option.

arguments.name: BMCOLOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of a carpet plot or dot plot, or the outline color of a box-and-whisker plot, in a bottom margin plot requested with the BMPLOT= option.

arguments.name: BMMARGIN=
arguments.description: Specifies the height in screen percentage units of a bottom margin plot requested with the BMPLOT= option.

arguments.name: BMPLOT=
arguments.description: Produces a carpet plot, dot plot, or box-and-whisker plot along the bottom margin of a histogram.

arguments.name: CARPET
arguments.description: A carpet plot represents each observation with a vertical line.

arguments.name: DOTPLOT
arguments.description: A dot plot marks each observation with a symbol.

arguments.name: SKELETAL
arguments.description: A box-and-whisker plot is produced with whiskers extending to the minimum and maximum values.

arguments.name: SCHEMATIC
arguments.description: A schematic box-and-whisker plot is produced. In a schematic box-and-whisker plot, the whiskers extend to the smallest value within the lower fence and the largest value within the upper fence.

arguments.name: C=
arguments.description: Specifies the shape parameter c for Weibull density curves requested with the WEIBULL option.

arguments.name: value-list
arguments.description: Specifies the shape parameter c for Weibull density curves requested with the WEIBULL option.

arguments.name: MISE
arguments.description: Requests the standardized bandwidth parameter that minimizes the estimated mean integrated square error (MISE).

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

arguments.name: CBARLINE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the outline of histogram bars.

arguments.name: CDELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option in parentheses after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in c between consecutive steps is less than the value specified or until the number of iterations exceeds the value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

arguments.name: CFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the bars of the histogram (or the area under a fitted density curve if you also specify the FILL option).

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area is not filled by default.

arguments.name: CFRAMESIDE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CFRAMETOP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across the top of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

arguments.name: CINITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 option. The default value is 1.8.

arguments.name: CLIPSPEC=
arguments.description: Specifies that histogram bars are clipped at the upper and lower specification limit lines when there are no observations outside the specification limits.

arguments.name: CLIP
arguments.description: The histogram bar is truncated at the specification limit.

arguments.name: NOFILL
arguments.description: The portion of a filled histogram bar outside the specification limit is left unfilled.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: CONTENTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot statement. You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

arguments.name: CPROP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding cell in a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: CTEXTSIDE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: CTEXTTOP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: CURVELEGEND=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limits and fitted curves.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limits and fitted curves.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend for fitted curves; this is equivalent to specifying the NOCURVELEGEND option.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

arguments.name: DELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the first shape parameter, delta, for Johnson SB and Johnson SU density curves requested with the SB and SU options.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable name.

arguments.name: ENDPOINTS
arguments.description: Specifies that histogram interval endpoints, rather than midpoints, are aligned with horizontal axis tick marks. The number of histogram intervals is based on the number of observations by using the method of Terrell and Scott (1985).

arguments.name: ENDPOINTS=
arguments.description: Specifies that histogram interval endpoints, rather than midpoints, are aligned with horizontal axis tick marks. The values must be listed in increasing order and must be evenly spaced. All observations in the input data set, as well as any specification limits, must lie between the first and last values specified.

arguments.name: EXPONENTIAL
arguments.description: Displays a fitted exponential density curve on the histogram. Description of exponential-options:

arguments.name: FILL
arguments.description: Fills areas under a parametric density curve or kernel density estimate with colors and patterns.

arguments.name: FITINTERVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

arguments.name: FITMETHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. By default, the method of percentiles is used.

arguments.name: PERCENTILE
arguments.description: Method of percentiles.

arguments.name: MLE
arguments.description: Method of MLE.

arguments.name: MOMENTS
arguments.description: Method of moments.

arguments.name: FITTOLERANCE=
arguments.description: Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: FORCEHIST
arguments.description: Forces the creation of a histogram if there is only one unique observation.

arguments.name: FRONTREF
arguments.description: Draws reference lines requested with the HREF= and VREF= options in front of the histogram bars.

arguments.name: GAMMA
arguments.description: Displays a fitted γ density curve on the histogram. You can specify the following gamma-options:

arguments.name: GAMMA=
arguments.description: Specifies the second shape parameter, γ, for Johnson SB and Johnson SU distribution functions requested with the SB and SU options.

arguments.name: HANGING
arguments.description: Requests a hanging histogram,

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark labels, and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: HMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

arguments.name: HOFFSET=
arguments.description: Specifies the offset, in percentage screen units, at both ends of the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: HREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: HREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.
Along top of plot
Staggered from top to bottom of plot
Along bottom of plot
Staggered from bottom to top of plot

arguments.name: INDICES
arguments.description: Requests capability indices based on the fitted distribution.

arguments.name: INFONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The INFONT= option takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: INHEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed areas of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: INTERTILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 to create contiguous tiles.

arguments.name: K=
arguments.description: Specifies the kernel function (normal, quadratic, or triangular) used to compute a kernel density estimate.

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: Normal kernel function

arguments.name: QUADRATIC
arguments.description: Quadratic kernel function

arguments.name: TRIANGULAR
arguments.description: Triangular kernel function

arguments.name: KERNEL
arguments.description: Superimposes up to five kernel density estimates on the histogram. You can specify the kernel-options described below:

arguments.name: L=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line types in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limit reference lines and fitted curves.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limit reference lines and fitted curves.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses all legend information, and is equivalent to specifying the NOLEGEND option.

arguments.name: LHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= option. By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: LOGNORMAL
arguments.description: Displays a fitted lognormal density curve on the histogram. You can specify the following lognormal-options:

arguments.name: LOWER=
arguments.description: Specifies lower bounds for kernel density estimates requested with the KERNEL option.

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. Enclose the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The default value of n is 20.

arguments.name: MIDPERCENTS
arguments.description: Requests a table listing the midpoints and percentage of observations in each histogram interval.

arguments.name: MIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: Specifies how to determine the midpoints for the histogram intervals, where value-list determines the width of the histogram bars as the difference between consecutive midpoints.

arguments.name: value-list
arguments.description: The values must be listed in increasing order and must be evenly spaced. The difference between consecutive midpoints is used as the width of the histogram bars.

arguments.name: KEY
arguments.description: The procedure first determines the midpoints for the data in the key cell. The initial number of midpoints is based on the number of observations in the key cell by using the method of Terrell and Scott (1985). The midpoint list for the key cell is then extended in either direction as necessary until it spans the data in the remaining cells.

arguments.name: UNIFORM
arguments.description: The procedure determines the midpoints using all the observations as if there were no cells. In other words, the number of midpoints is computed from the total sample size by using the method of Terrell and Scott (1985).

arguments.name: MIDPTAXIS=
arguments.description: Is an alias for the HAXIS= option.

arguments.name: MU=
arguments.description: Specifies the parameter, µ, for normal density curves requested with the NORMAL option.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 'UNIVAR'.

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only one CLASS variable, and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

arguments.name: NENDPOINTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of histogram interval endpoints and causes the endpoints, rather than interval midpoints, to be aligned with horizontal axis tick marks.

arguments.name: NMIDPOINTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of histogram intervals.

arguments.name: NOBARS
arguments.description: Suppresses drawing of histogram bars.

arguments.name: NOCURVELEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the portion of the legend for fitted curves.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.

arguments.name: NOHLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses legends for specification limits, fitted curves, distribution lines, and hidden observations.

arguments.name: NOPLOT
arguments.description: Suppresses the creation of a plot.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses printed output summarizing the fitted curve.

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: Displays a fitted normal density curve on the histogram. The following normal-options can be specified:

arguments.name: NOSPECLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the portion of the legend for specification limit reference lines.

arguments.name: NOVLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

arguments.name: NOVTICK
arguments.description: Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option also suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

arguments.name: OUTFIT=
arguments.description: Creates a SAS data set that contains parameter estimates for fitted curves and related goodness-of-fit information.

arguments.name: OUTHISTOGRAM=
arguments.description: Creates a SAS data set that contains information about histogram intervals.

arguments.name: OVERLAY
arguments.description: Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid onto a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

arguments.name: PERCENTS=
arguments.description: Specifies a list of percents for which quantiles calculated from the data and quantiles estimated from the fitted curve are tabulated.

arguments.name: PFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies a pattern used to fill the bars of the histograms (or the areas under a fitted curve if you also specify the FILL option) when producing traditional graphics.

arguments.name: RTINCLUDE
arguments.description: Includes the right endpoint of each histogram interval in that interval.

arguments.name: SB
arguments.description: Displays a fitted Johnson SB density curve on the histogram. You can specify the following SB-options:

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

arguments.name: SHAPE=
arguments.description: Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for the C= option for distributions requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

arguments.name: SIGMA=
arguments.description: Specifies the parameter, σ, for curves requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, NORMAL, SB, SU, and WEIBULL options.

arguments.name: SPECLEGEND=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limits and fitted curves.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limits and fitted curves.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Suppresses the portion of the legend for specification limit references lines, is equivalent to specifying the NOSPECLEGEND option.

arguments.name: SU
arguments.description: Displays a fitted Johnson SU density curve on the histogram. You can specify the following SU-options:

arguments.name: SYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used for the density curve or kernel density curve in line printer plots.

arguments.name: THETA=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for curves requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, SB, and WEIBULL options, and the location parameter, θ, for curves requested with the SU option.

arguments.name: TURNVLABELS
arguments.description: Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. This happens by default when you use a hardware font.

arguments.name: UPPER=
arguments.description: Specifies the upper bound for kernel density estimates requested with the KERNEL option.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VAXISLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

arguments.name: VMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also see the CVREF= and LVREF= options.

arguments.name: VREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.
Labels are positioned at the left of the plot.
Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

arguments.name: VSCALE=
