arguments.description: Specifies the scale of the vertical axis.

arguments.name: PERCENT
arguments.description: Scales the data in units of percent of observations per data unit. This is the default.

arguments.name: COUNT
arguments.description: Scales the data in units of the number of observations per data unit.

arguments.name: PROPORTION
arguments.description: Scales the data in units of proportion of observations per data unit.

arguments.name: W=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of widths in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: WAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

arguments.name: WBARLINE=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of bar outlines. By default, n=1.

arguments.name: WEIBULL
arguments.description: Displays a fitted Weibull density curve on the histogram. You can specify the following Weibull-options:

arguments.name: ZETA=
arguments.description: Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ, for lognormal density curves requested with the LOGNORMAL option.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: The ID statement specifies variables used to identify observations. The ID variables must be variables in the DATA= or SUMMARY= input data sets.

statements.name: INSET
statements.description: An INSET statement places a box or table of summary statistics, called an inset, directly in a graph created with a CDFPLOT, HISTOGRAM, PPPLOT, PROBPLOT, or QQPLOT statement.

arguments.name: CFILL=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the background (including the header background if you do not specify the CFILLH= option). CFILL=BLANK leaves the background uncolored and prevents items from showing through the inset.

arguments.name: CFILL=
arguments.description: Leaves the background uncolored and prevents items from showing through the inset.

arguments.description: Specifies the color of the header background. The default value is the CFILL= color.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the frame. The default value is the same color as the axis of the plot.

arguments.name: CHEADER=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the header text. The default value is the CTEXT= color.

arguments.name: CPMLCL

arguments.name: CSHADOW=

arguments.name: CTEXT=

arguments.name: DATA

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: (label, value) pairs from SAS-data-set

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies the font of the text. By default, the font is SIMPLEX if the inset is located in the interior of the plot, and the font is the same as the other text displayed on the plot if the inset is located in the exterior of the plot.

arguments.name: FORMAT=
arguments.description: Specifies a format for all the values in the inset.

arguments.name: GUTTER=
arguments.description: Specifies the gutter width in percent screen units for an inset located in the top or bottom margin.

arguments.name: HEADER=
arguments.description: Specifies the header text. The string cannot exceed 40 characters. By default, no header line appears in the inset.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height of the text.

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of columns of (label, value) pairs displayed in an inset located in the top or bottom margin.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the frame drawn around the text.

arguments.name: POSITION=
arguments.description: Determines the position of the inset. The position can be a compass point keyword, a margin keyword, or a pair of coordinates (x,y). You can specify coordinates in axis percent units or axis data units.

arguments.name: REFPOINT=
arguments.description: Specifies the reference point for an inset that is positioned by a pair of coordinates with the POSITION= option.

arguments.name: BR
arguments.description: Bottom right

arguments.name: BL
arguments.description: Bottom left (the default)

arguments.name: TR
arguments.description: Top right

arguments.name: TL

arguments.description: Specifies values of α, the probability or confidence associated with the interval.

arguments.name: K=
arguments.description: Lists values of k for prediction intervals. Default values of 1, 2, and 3 are used for the prediction interval for k future observations and for the prediction interval for the mean of k future observations.

arguments.name: METHODS=
arguments.description: Specifies which intervals are computed. The indices can range from 1 to 6.
Approximate simultaneous prediction interval for k future observations
Prediction interval for the mean of k future observations
Approximate statistical tolerance interval that contains at least proportion p of the population
Confidence interval for the population mean
Prediction interval for the standard deviation of k future observations
Confidence interval for the population standard deviation

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses the tables produced by default.

arguments.name: OUTINTERVALS=
arguments.description: Specifies an output SAS data set containing the intervals and related information.

arguments.name: P=
arguments.description: Lists values of p for the tolerance intervals. These values must be between 0.00001 to 0.99999.

arguments.name: TYPE=
arguments.description: Determines whether the intervals computed are one-sided lower, one-sided upper, or two-sided intervals, respectively.

arguments.name: UPPER

arguments.name: TWOSIDED

statements.name: PPPLOT
statements.description: The PPPLOT statement creates a probability-probability plot (also referred to as a P-P plot or percent plot), which compares the empirical cumulative distribution function (ecdf) of a variable with a specified theoretical cumulative distribution function such as the normal.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies the shape parameter α (α > 0) for P-P plots requested with the BETA and GAMMA options.

arguments.name: ALPHADELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option.

arguments.name: ALPHAINITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option. Enclose the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.

arguments.name: ANNOKEY
arguments.description: Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

arguments.name: BETA
arguments.description: Creates a beta P-P plot. You can specify the following beta-options:

arguments.name: BETA=
arguments.description: Specifies the shape parameter, β, for P-P plots requested by the BETA option.

arguments.name: C=
arguments.description: Specifies the shape parameter, c, for P-P plots requested with the WEIBULL option

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

arguments.name: CDELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option in parentheses after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in between consecutive steps is less than the value specified or until the number of iterations exceeds the value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area is not filled by default.

arguments.name: CFRAMESIDE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CFRAMETOP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across the top of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

arguments.name: CINITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 option. The default value is 1.8.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: CONTENTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot statement. You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

arguments.name: CPROP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding cell in a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: CTEXTSIDE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: CTEXTTOP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable name.

arguments.name: EXPONENTIAL
arguments.description: Creates an exponential P-P plot. You can specify the following exponential-options: SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line NOLINE -- suppresses the distribution reference line SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

arguments.name: FITINTERVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

arguments.name: FITMETHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. By default, the method of percentiles is used.

arguments.name: PERCENTILE
arguments.description: Method of percentiles.

arguments.name: MLE
arguments.description: Method of MLE.

arguments.name: MOMENTS
arguments.description: Method of moments.

arguments.name: FITTOLERANCE=
arguments.description: Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: GAMMA
arguments.description: Creates a gamma P-P plot. You can specify the following gamma-options: ALPHA=value -- specifies shape parameter, α SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line NOLINE -- suppresses the distribution reference line SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark labels, and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: HMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

arguments.name: HREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: HREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.
Along top of plot
Staggered from top to bottom of plot
Along bottom of plot
Staggered from bottom to top of plot

arguments.name: INFONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The INFONT= option takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: INHEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed areas of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: INTERTILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 to create contiguous tiles.

arguments.name: L=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line types in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: LHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= option. By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: LOGNORMAL
arguments.description: Creates a lognormal P-P plot. You can specify the following lognormal-options: SIGMA=value -- specifies shape parameter, σ THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ ZETA=value -- specifies scale parameter, ζ COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line NOLINE -- suppresses the distribution reference line SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. Enclose the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The default value of n is 20.

arguments.name: MU=
arguments.description: Specifies the parameter, µ, for normal P-P plot requested with the NORMAL option.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 'UNIVAR'.

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only one CLASS variable, and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.

arguments.name: NOHLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

arguments.name: NOLINE
arguments.description: Suppresses the diagonal reference line.

arguments.name: NOOBSLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend that indicates the number of hidden observations.

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: Creates a normal P-P plot. You can specify the following normal-options: MU=value -- specifies mean SIGMA=value -- specifies standard deviation COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line NOLINE -- suppresses the distribution reference line SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

arguments.name: NOVLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

arguments.name: NOVTICK
arguments.description: Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option also suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

arguments.name: OVERLAY
arguments.description: Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid onto a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

arguments.name: PPSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to plot the points in a line printer plot. The default is the plus sign (+).

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

arguments.name: SHAPE=
arguments.description: Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for the C= option for distributions requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

arguments.name: SIGMA=
arguments.description: Specifies the scale parameter, σ, for P-P plots requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, NORMAL, and WEIBULL options

arguments.name: SQUARE
arguments.description: Displays the P-P plot in a square frame. The default is a rectangular frame.

arguments.name: SYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used for the diagonal reference line in line printer plots. The default character is the first letter of the distribution option keyword.

arguments.name: THETA=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for plots requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, and WEIBULL options.

arguments.name: TURNVLABELS
arguments.description: Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. This happens by default when you use a hardware font.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VAXISLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

arguments.name: VMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also see the CVREF= and LVREF= options.

arguments.name: VREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.
Labels are positioned at the left of the plot.
Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

arguments.name: W=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of widths in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: WAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

arguments.name: WEIBULL
arguments.description: Creates a Weibull P-P plot. You can specify the following Weibull-options: C=value -- specifies shape parameter,c SIGMA=value -- specifies scale parameter, σ THETA=value -- specifies threshold parameter, θ COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line NOLINE -- suppresses the distribution reference line SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

arguments.name: ZETA=
arguments.description: Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ, for a lognormal P-P plots requested with the LOGNORMAL option.

statements.name: PROBPLOT
statements.description: The PROBPLOT statement creates a probability plot, which compares ordered variable values with the percentiles of a specified theoretical distribution. If the data distribution matches the theoretical distribution, the points on the plot form a linear pattern.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies values for a mandatory shape parameter α (α > 0) for probability plots requested with the BETA and GAMMA options.

arguments.name: ALPHADELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option.

arguments.name: ALPHAINITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option. Enclose the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.

arguments.name: ANNOKEY
arguments.description: Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

arguments.name: BETA
arguments.description: Creates a beta probability plot for each combination of the required shape parameters, α and β, specified by the required ALPHA= and BETA= beta-options. You can specify the following beta-options:

arguments.name: BETA=
arguments.description: Specifies values for the shape parameter β for probability plots requested with the BETA option.

arguments.name: C=
arguments.description: Specifies the shape parameter, c, for probability plots requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

arguments.name: value-list
arguments.description: Specifies the shape parameter, c, for probability plots requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. You must specify C= as a Weibull-option with the WEIBULL option; in this situation it accepts a list of values.

arguments.name: EST
arguments.description: If you specify C=EST, a maximum likelihood estimate is computed for c. You can optionally specify C=value or C=EST as a Weibull2-option with the WEIBULL2 option to request a distribution reference line; in this situation, you must also specify SIGMA=value or SIGMA=EST.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

arguments.name: CDELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option in parentheses after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in c between consecutive steps is less than the value specified or until the number of iterations exceeds the value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area is not filled by default.

arguments.name: CFRAMESIDE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CFRAMETOP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across the top of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

arguments.name: CINITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 option. The default value is 1.8.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: CONTENTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot statement. You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

arguments.name: CPROP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding cell in a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: CTEXTSIDE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: CTEXTTOP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable name.

arguments.name: EXPONENTIAL
arguments.description: Creates an exponential probability plot. Available exponential-options are: SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line THETA=value|EST -- specifies θ0 for distribution reference line COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

arguments.name: FITINTERVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

arguments.name: FITMETHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. By default, the method of percentiles is used.

arguments.name: PERCENTILE
arguments.description: Method of percentiles.

arguments.name: MLE
arguments.description: Method of MLE.

arguments.name: MOMENTS
arguments.description: Method of moments.

arguments.name: FITTOLERANCE=
arguments.description: Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: GAMMA
arguments.description: Creates a gamma probability plot for each value of the shape parameter α given by the mandatory ALPHA= gamma-option. Available gamma-options are:

arguments.name: GRID
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the percentile axis at major tick marks.

arguments.name: GRIDCHAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used for the lines requested by the GRID option for a line printer plot. The default is the vertical bar (|).

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark labels, and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: HMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

arguments.name: HREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: HREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.
Along top of plot
Staggered from top to bottom of plot
Along bottom of plot
Staggered from bottom to top of plot

arguments.name: INFONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The INFONT= option takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: INHEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed areas of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: INTERTILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 to create contiguous tiles.

arguments.name: L=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line types in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: Identifies the LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limit reference lines and fitted curves.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limit reference lines and fitted curves.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Specifying LEGEND=NONE is equivalent to specifying the NOLEGEND option.

arguments.name: LGRID=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the reference lines requested by the GRID= option. By default, LGRID=1, which produces a solid line.

arguments.name: LHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= option. By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: LOGNORMAL
arguments.description: Creates a lognormal probability plot for each value of the shape parameter σ given by the mandatory SIGMA= option. Available lognormal-options are:

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. Enclose the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The default value of n is 20.

arguments.name: MU=
arguments.description: Specifies the mean, µ, for a normal probability plot requested with the NORMAL option.

arguments.name: NADJ=
arguments.description: Specifies the adjustment value added to the sample size in the calculation of theoretical percentiles. The default is 1/4, as recommended by Blom (1958).

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 'UNIVAR'.

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only one CLASS variable, and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.

arguments.name: NOHLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses legends for specification limits, fitted curves, distribution lines, and hidden observations.

arguments.name: NOLINELEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend for the optional distribution reference line.

arguments.name: NOOBSLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend that indicates the number of hidden observations.

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: ' Creates a normal probability plot. Available normal-options are: MU=value|EST -- specifies u0 for distribution reference line SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

arguments.name: NOSPECLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend for specification limit reference lines.

arguments.name: NOVLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

arguments.name: NOVTICK
arguments.description: Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option also suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

arguments.name: OVERLAY
arguments.description: Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid onto a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

arguments.name: PCTLMINOR
arguments.description: Requests minor tick marks for the percentile axis.

arguments.name: PCTLORDER=
arguments.description: Specifies the tick mark values labeled on the theoretical percentile axis.

arguments.name: PROBSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to mark the points in a line printer plot. The default is the plus sign (+).

arguments.name: RANKADJ=
arguments.description: Specifies the adjustment value added to the ranks in the calculation of theoretical percentiles.

arguments.name: ROTATE
arguments.description: Switches the horizontal and vertical axes so that the theoretical percentiles are plotted vertically while the data are plotted horizontally.

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

arguments.name: SHAPE=
arguments.description: Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for the C= option for distributions requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

arguments.name: SIGMA=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of the parameter σ, where σ > 0. Alternatively, you can specify SIGMA=EST to request a maximum likelihood estimate for σ0.

arguments.name: SLOPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the slope for a distribution reference line requested with the LOGNORMAL and WEIBULL2 options.

arguments.name: SQUARE
arguments.description: Displays the probability plot in a square frame. The default is a rectangular frame.

arguments.name: SYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to display the distribution reference line in a line printer plot.

arguments.name: THETA=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for plots requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

arguments.name: TURNVLABELS
arguments.description: Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. This happens by default when you use a hardware font.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VAXISLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

arguments.name: VMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also see the CVREF= and LVREF= options.

arguments.name: VREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.
Labels are positioned at the left of the plot.
Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

arguments.name: W=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of widths in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: WAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

arguments.name: WEIBULL2
arguments.description: Creates a two-parameter Weibull probability plot. You should use the WEIBULL2 option when your data have a known lower threshold, θ0. Available Weibull2-options are:

arguments.name: WEIBULL
arguments.description: Creates a three-parameter Weibull probability plot for each value of the required shape parameter, c, specified by the mandatory C= Weibull-option. Available Weibull-options are:

arguments.name: ZETA=
arguments.description: Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ, for lognormal probability plots requested with the LOGNORMAL option.

statements.name: QQPLOT
statements.description: TThe QQPLOT statement creates quantile-quantile plots (Q-Q plots) and compares ordered variable values with quantiles of a specified theoretical distribution.

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: Specifies values for a mandatory shape parameter α (α > 0) for Q-Q plots requested with the BETA and GAMMA options.

arguments.name: ALPHADELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the change in successive estimates of α-hat at which iteration terminates in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option.

arguments.name: ALPHAINITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial value for α-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option. Enclose the ALPHAINITIAL= option in parentheses after the GAMMA keyword.

arguments.name: ANNOKEY
arguments.description: Applies the annotation requested with the ANNOTATE= option only to the key cell of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: ANNOTATE=
arguments.description: Specifies an input data set that contains annotate variables.

arguments.name: BETA
arguments.description: Creates a beta Q-Q plot for each combination of the required shape parameters, α and β, specified by the required ALPHA= and BETA= beta-options. You can specify the following beta-options:

arguments.name: BETA=
arguments.description: Specifies values for the shape parameter, β, for Q-Q plots requested with the BETA option.

arguments.name: C=
arguments.description: Specifies the shape parameter, c, for Q-Q plots requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

arguments.name: value-list
arguments.description: Specifies the shape parameter, c, for Q-Q plots requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

arguments.name: EST
arguments.description: You must specify C= as a Weibull-option with the WEIBULL option; in this situation it accepts a list of values, or if you specify C=EST, a maximum likelihood estimate is computed for c. You can optionally specify C=value or C=EST as a Weibull2-option with the WEIBULL2 option to request a distribution reference line; in this situation, you must also specify SIGMA=value or SIGMA=EST.

arguments.name: CAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the axes and tick marks.

arguments.name: CDELTA=
arguments.description: Specifies the change in successive estimates of c at which iterations terminate in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested by the WEIBULL option. Enclose the CDELTA= option in parentheses after the WEIBULL keyword. Iteration continues until the change in c between consecutive steps is less than the value specified or until the number of iterations exceeds the value of the MAXITER= option. The default value is 0.00001.

arguments.name: CFRAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the area that is enclosed by the axes and frame. The area is not filled by default.

arguments.name: CFRAMESIDE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CFRAMETOP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color to fill the frame area for the column labels that display across the top of a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for horizontal axis reference lines requested by the HREF= option.

arguments.name: CINITIAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the initial value for c-hat in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL or WEIBULL2 option. The default value is 1.8.

arguments.name: COLOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the COLOR= option in parentheses after a distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of colors in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: CONTENTS=
arguments.description: Specifies the table of contents grouping entry for output produced by the plot statement. You can specify CONTENTS='' to suppress the grouping entry.

arguments.name: CPKREF
arguments.description: Draws reference lines extending from the intersections of the specification limits with the distribution reference line to the quantile axis in plots requested with the NORMAL option.

arguments.name: CPKSCALE
arguments.description: Rescales the quantile axis in Cpk units for plots requested with the NORMAL option.

arguments.name: CPROP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for a horizontal bar whose length (relative to the width of the tile) indicates the proportion of the total frequency that is represented by the corresponding cell in a comparative plot.

arguments.name: CTEXT=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for tick mark values and axis labels. The default is the color specified for the CTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: CTEXTSIDE=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the row labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: CTEXTTOP=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for the column labels that display along the left side of a comparative plot. By default, the color specified by the CTEXT= option is used. If you omit the CTEXT= option, the color specified in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: CVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the color for lines requested with the VREF= option.

arguments.name: DESCRIPTION=
arguments.description: Specifies a description, up to 256 characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is the analysis variable name.

arguments.name: EXPONENTIAL
arguments.description: Creates an exponential Q-Q plot. Available exponential-options are: SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line THETA=value|EST -- specifies θ0 for distribution reference line COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

arguments.name: FITINTERVAL=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of z for the method of percentiles when this method is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITINTERVAL= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default of z is 0.524.

arguments.name: FITMETHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the method used to estimate the parameters of a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITMETHOD= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. By default, the method of percentiles is used.

arguments.name: PERCENTILE
arguments.description: Method of percentiles.

arguments.name: MLE
arguments.description: Method of MLE.

arguments.name: MOMENTS
arguments.description: Method of moments.

arguments.name: FITTOLERANCE=
arguments.description: Specifies the tolerance value for the ratio criterion when the method of percentiles is used to fit a Johnson sB or Johnson sU distribution. The FITTOLERANCE= option is specified in parentheses after the SB or SU option. The default value is 0.01.

arguments.name: FONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font for reference line and axis labels. You can also specify fonts for axis labels in an AXIS statement. The FONT= font takes precedence over the FTEXT= font specified in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: GAMMA
arguments.description: Creates a gamma Q-Q plot for each value of the shape parameter α given by the mandatory ALPHA= gamma-option. Available gamma-options are:

arguments.name: HAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the horizontal axis.

arguments.name: HEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text for axis labels, tick mark labels, and legends. This option takes precedence over the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: HMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the horizontal axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. By default, HMINOR=0.

arguments.name: HREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the HREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: HREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the vertical position of the HREFLABELS= labels.
Along top of plot
Staggered from top to bottom of plot
Along bottom of plot
Staggered from bottom to top of plot

arguments.name: INFONT=
arguments.description: Specifies a software font to use for text inside the framed areas of the plot. The INFONT= option takes precedence over the FTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement.

arguments.name: INHEIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the height, in percentage screen units, of text used inside the framed areas of the histogram. By default, the height specified by the HEIGHT= option is used. If you do not specify the HEIGHT= option, the height specified with the HTEXT= option in the GOPTIONS statement is used.

arguments.name: INTERTILE=
arguments.description: Specifies the distance in horizontal percentage screen units between the framed areas, called tiles, of a comparative plot. By default, INTERTILE=0.75 percentage screen units. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. You can specify INTERTILE=0 to create contiguous tiles.

arguments.name: L=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the L= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of line types in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: LEGEND=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limit reference lines and fitted curves. Specifying LEGEND=NONE is equivalent to specifying the NOLEGEND option.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: Specifies the name of a LEGEND statement describing the legend for specification limit reference lines and fitted curves.

arguments.name: NONE
arguments.description: Specifying LEGEND=NONE is equivalent to specifying the NOLEGEND option.

arguments.name: LHREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the reference lines that you request with the HREF= option. By default, LHREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: LOGNORMAL
arguments.description: Creates a lognormal Q-Q plot for each value of the shape parameter, σ, given by the mandatory SIGMA= option. Available lognormal-options are:

arguments.name: LVREF=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for lines requested with the VREF= option. By default, LVREF=2, which produces a dashed line.

arguments.name: MAXITER=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of iterations in the Newton-Raphson approximation of the maximum likelihood estimate of α for gamma distributions requested with the GAMMA option and c for Weibull distributions requested with the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options. Enclose the MAXITER= option in parentheses after the GAMMA, WEIBULL, or WEIBULL2 keywords. The default value of n is 20.

arguments.name: MU=
arguments.description: Specifies the mean, µ, for a normal Q-Q plot requested with the NORMAL option.

arguments.name: NADJ=
arguments.description: Specifies the adjustment value added to the sample size in the calculation of theoretical percentiles. The default is 1/4, as recommended by Blom (1958).

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: Specifies a name for the plot, up to eight characters long, that appears in the PROC GREPLAY master menu for a traditional graphics chart. The default value is 'UNIVAR'.

arguments.name: NCOLS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of columns per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NCOLS=1 if you specify only one CLASS variable, and NCOLS=2 if you specify two CLASS variables. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

arguments.name: NOFRAME
arguments.description: Suppresses the frame around the subplot area.

arguments.name: NOHLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the horizontal axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

arguments.name: NOLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses legends for specification limits, fitted curves, distribution lines, and hidden observations.

arguments.name: NOLINELEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend for the optional distribution reference line.

arguments.name: NOOBSLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend that indicates the number of hidden observations.

arguments.name: NORMAL
arguments.description: Creates a normal Q-Q plot. Available normal-options are: MU=value|EST -- specifies u0 for distribution reference line SIGMA=value|EST -- specifies σ0 for distribution reference line COLOR=color -- specifies color of distribution reference line L=linetype -- specifies line type of distribution reference line SYMBOL='character' -- specifies plotting character for line printer plots W= -- specifies width of distribution reference line

arguments.name: NOSPECLEGEND
arguments.description: Suppresses the legend for specification limit reference lines.

arguments.name: NOVLABEL
arguments.description: Suppresses the label for the vertical axis. You can use this option to reduce clutter.

arguments.name: NOVTICK
arguments.description: Suppresses the tick marks and tick mark labels for the vertical axis. This option also suppresses the label for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: NROWS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of rows per panel in a comparative plot. This option is not available unless you use the CLASS statement. By default, NROWS=2. If you specify two CLASS variables, you can use the NCOLS= option with the NROWS= option.

arguments.name: OVERLAY
arguments.description: Specifies that plots associated with different levels of a CLASS variable be overlaid onto a single plot, rather than displayed as separate cells in a comparative plot.

arguments.name: PCTLAXIS
arguments.description: Adds a nonlinear percentile axis along the frame of the Q-Q plot opposite the theoretical quantile axis. You can specify the following axis-options:

arguments.name: PCTLMINOR
arguments.description: Requests minor tick marks for the percentile axis.

arguments.name: PCTLSCALE
arguments.description: Requests scale labels for the theoretical quantile axis in percentile units, resulting in a nonlinear axis scale.

arguments.name: QQSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to mark the points in a line printer plot. The default is the plus sign (+).

arguments.name: RANKADJ=
arguments.description: Specifies the adjustment value added to the ranks in the calculation of theoretical percentiles.

arguments.name: ROTATE
arguments.description: Switches the horizontal and vertical axes so that the theoretical percentiles are plotted vertically while the data are plotted horizontally.

arguments.name: SCALE=
arguments.description: Is an alias for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, SB, SU, WEIBULL, and WEIBULL2 options and for the ZETA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option.

arguments.name: SHAPE=
arguments.description: Is an alias for the ALPHA= option for distributions requested by the GAMMA option, for the SIGMA= option for distributions requested by the LOGNORMAL option, and for the C= option for distributions requested by the WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

arguments.name: SIGMA=
arguments.description: Specifies the value of the distribution parameter σ, where σ > 0. Alternatively, you can specify SIGMA=EST to request a maximum likelihood estimate for σ0.

arguments.name: SLOPE=
arguments.description: Specifies the slope for a distribution reference line requested with the LOGNORMAL and WEIBULL2 options.

arguments.name: SQUARE
arguments.description: Displays the Q-Q plot in a square frame. The default is a rectangular frame.

arguments.name: SYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to display the distribution reference line in a line printer plot.

arguments.name: THETA=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower threshold parameter, θ, for Q-Q plots requested with the BETA, EXPONENTIAL, GAMMA, LOGNORMAL, WEIBULL and WEIBULL2 options.

arguments.name: TURNVLABELS
arguments.description: Turns the characters in the vertical axis labels so that they display vertically. This happens by default when you use a hardware font.

arguments.name: VAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the name of an AXIS statement describing the vertical axis. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can alternatively specify a value-list for the vertical axis.

arguments.name: VAXISLABEL=
arguments.description: Specifies a label for the vertical axis. Labels can have up to 40 characters.

arguments.name: VMINOR=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of minor tick marks between each major tick mark on the vertical axis. Minor tick marks are not labeled. The default is zero.

arguments.name: VREF=
arguments.description: Draws reference lines perpendicular to the vertical axis at the values specified. Also see the CVREF= and LVREF= options.

arguments.name: VREFLABELS=
arguments.description: Specifies labels for the lines requested by the VREF= option. The number of labels must equal the number of lines. Enclose each label in quotes. Labels can have up to 16 characters.

arguments.name: VREFLABPOS=
arguments.description: Specifies the horizontal position of the VREFLABELS= labels.
Labels are positioned at the left of the plot.
Labels are positioned at the right of the plot.

arguments.name: W=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the curve or reference line associated with a distribution or kernel density estimate. Enclose the W= option in parentheses after the distribution option or the KERNEL option. In a HISTOGRAM statement, you can specify a list of widths in parentheses for multiple density curves.

arguments.name: WAXIS=
arguments.description: Specifies the line thickness, in pixels, for the axes and frame.

arguments.name: WEIBULL2
arguments.description: Creates a two-parameter Weibull Q-Q plot. You should use the WEIBULL2 option when your data have a known lower threshold, θ0. Available Weibull2-options are:

arguments.name: WEIBULL
arguments.description: Creates a three-parameter Weibull Q-Q plot for each value of the required shape parameter, c, specified by the mandatory C= option. Available Weibull-options are:

arguments.name: ZETA=
arguments.description: Specifies a value for the scale parameter, ζ, for lognormal Q-Q plots requested with the LOGNORMAL option.

arguments.name: CLEFT=
arguments.description: Determines the color used to fill the area under a histogram to the left of the lower specification limit.

arguments.name: CLSL=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the lower specification line displayed in plots created with the CDFPLOT, COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

arguments.name: CRIGHT=
arguments.description: Determines the color used to fill the area under a histogram to the right of the upper specification limit.

arguments.name: CTARGET=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the target line displayed in plots created with the CDFPLOT, COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

arguments.name: CUSL=
arguments.description: Specifies the color of the upper specification line displayed in plots created with the CDFPLOT, COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

arguments.name: LLSL=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the lower specification line displayed in plots created with the CDFPLOT, COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

arguments.name: LSL=
arguments.description: Specifies the lower specification limits for the variables listed in the VAR statement, or for all numeric variables in the input data set if no VAR statement is used.

arguments.name: LSLSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to display the lower specification line in line printer plots created with the CDFPLOT, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements. The default character is 'L'.

arguments.name: LTARGET=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the target line in plots created with the CDFPLOT, COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

arguments.name: LUSL=
arguments.description: Specifies the line type for the upper specification line displayed in plots created with the CDFPLOT, COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

arguments.name: PLEFT=
arguments.description: Specifies the pattern used to fill the area under a histogram to the left of the lower specification limit.

arguments.name: PRIGHT=
arguments.description: Specifies the pattern used to fill the area under a histogram to the right of the upper specification limit.

arguments.name: TARGET=
arguments.description: Specifies a target values for the variables listed in the VAR statement, or for all numeric variables in the input data set if no VAR statement is used.

arguments.name: TARGETSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to display the target line in line printer plots created with the CDFPLOT, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements. The default character is 'T'.

arguments.name: USL=
arguments.description: Specifies the upper specification limits for the variables listed in the VAR statement, or for all numeric variables in the input data set if no VAR statement is used.

arguments.name: USLSYMBOL=
arguments.description: Specifies the character used to display the upper specification line in line printer plots created with the CDFPLOT, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements. The default character is 'U'.

arguments.name: WLSL=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the lower specification line in plots created with the CDFPLOT, COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

arguments.name: WTARGET=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the target line in plots created with the CDFPLOT, COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

arguments.name: WUSL=
arguments.description: Specifies the width in pixels of the upper specification line in plots created with the CDFPLOT, COMPHISTOGRAM, HISTOGRAM, PROBPLOT, and QQPLOT statements.

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: VAR variables; Specifies the numeric variables to be analyzed. If the VAR statement is omitted, all numeric variables not specified in other statements are analyzed.

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: The WEIGHT statement names a variable that provides weights for each observation in the input data set.
